results.overview:
OUR MISSION

 

STAR Academy is a public school located in District 1 in Manhattan. We are a beautiful, small, inclusive, and diverse community where all learners’ strengths are valued so that they are empowered to think critically about equity and access with the vision of becoming engaged change-makers and advocates for social justice. We are committed to culturally responsive and anti-racist curriculum, practices, and ways of being.
We proudly serve children, 3K to 5th grades, from all 5 boroughs. We offer art, physical education and STEM during the school day. We also have a variety of afterschool programs.

other_features.name: Contact Program for Extended Day Options
Priority is given to applicants who reside in district 1

results.overview:
We believe and inspire to create an educational atmosphere for ALL students to engage in curricula that embeds discourse, multi-facet engagement, differentiated instruction, and rigorous opportunities within the learning. 

*Discourse â Having significant communication skills is critical, valuable in the workplace and in our lives. Having collaborative discussion will allow our students to work together on existing and new ideas/inquiry, which will provide opportunities for input and feedback. As a result, our students will assume shared responsibilities and contribute to accomplishing common goals in meaningful and respectful ways. 

*Multi-Facet Engagement- Students show their thinking and learning in a creative and expressive manner. The teacher plays the role of a facilitator as students take ownership of their learning. Students use accountable talk, academic vocabulary, to challenge one anotherâs thinking. Through daily problem solving, synthesizing of information and exploration, students will experience learning in new and remarkable ways. 

*Differentiated instruction â Each student has a unique learning style and interest. We provide students with varying avenues and opportunities for learning. Through continuous data driven instruction, we address various learning needs and develop personalized instruction so that ALL students can learn effectively. 

*Rigorous Opportunities â By providing a set of intentionally aligned components, we create learning outcomes that offer engaging experiences and instructional strategies into an organized sequential unit of study. This serves as a road map to high quality teaching and learning.

results.overview:
P.S. 368 is a 3K - 6 school (expanding to 7th grade SY 2025, expanding to 8th grade SY 2026) that provides a progressive educational approach to a diverse population of
students in an atmosphere that is culturally responsive, nurturing, supportive, and inclusive.
Our mission is to develop social awareness among our students, and expose them to the broader issues facing our surrounding communities.  Our instructional focus is to increase student engagement in all subject areas by developing and implementing authentic,
collaborative student-centered tasks, moving from teacher directed instruction to deepening
student learning.

Priority is given to applicants who reside in district 6

results.overview:
Our students will develop agency in their learning through a curriculum that is responsive to the emotional needs, cultural backgrounds and great intellectual potential of our students. We will provide targeted instruction guided by teachers who will continue to enhance their own understanding of child development/cognition, research supported pedagogy and instructional technology. Our students will strengthen their collaborative skills, deepen their understanding of citizenship in the local and global community and develop a profound respect for their individual courage as risk takers, and our families will enhance their ability to become active and engaged participants in the learning process.

We are curious in our learning
The Windsor Terrace School will motivate and prepare our students for a rapidly changing world by instilling in them; critical thinking skills, a global perspective and a desire for intellectual exploration.

We care for ourselves and our community
The Windsor Terrace School will motivate and prepare our students to become active and empathetic citizens who can identify problems and work collaboratively to solve them. 

We are courageous in our actions
The Windsor Terrace School will motivate and prepare our students to become comfortable in discomfort, to ask questions, to take risks and to stand up for what they believe is just and right.

other_features.name: Priority is given to applicants who reside in district 15

results.overview: Enrollment in kindergarten to sixth grade in a public elementary does not guarantee school bus service. For more information please visit schools.nyc.gov/BusEligibility. The Autism Horizon Program supports students with autism in a special class with eight students, a special education teacher and paraprofessional with emphasis on building skills and offering opportunities for meaningful inclusion in larger settings. Students in this program may need additional academic support and require speech and language services, including in areas of social or pragmatic communication. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to Specialized Programs for Students with Disabilities (nyc.gov).

results.overview: PS/IS 366: Washington Heights Academy (06M366) is a New York City Department of Education public school located in District 6, serving children from diverse cultural, linguistic and socio-economic backgrounds. Washington Heights Academy serves two classes per grade in Pre-Kindergarten to Grade 8. Many of our students remain part of our learning community from the age of 4 to the age of 14. Our graduates are well prepared to attend a wide variety of high schools based on their individual interests and needs.

results.overview:
The Waterside Childrens Studio School will be relocated to the Q593 building at 140 Beach 112th Street, Queens, NY, 11694 beginning in the 2023-2024 school year. WCSS MISSION 
At the Waterside Childrenâs Studio School, our mission is to inspire a community of life- long learners by nurturing their innovation, creativity and social-emotional well-being in a diverse and inclusive environment. 

WCSS VISION 
At the Waterside Children's Studio School, our vision is to provide a safe and nurturing 21st Century learning environment where creativity and artistic expression are integral to the academic and emotional success of every child. Through music, drama, visual arts, film, technology, writing and dance, our rigorous and progressive curriculum will empower ALL of our children to grow academically, creatively and socially. They will acquire the critical thinking, personal integrity and self-esteem that go beyond the classroom walls. As a community, we will take pride and ownership of our school and celebrate all of our accomplishments.
 This school has ASD Nest: Open to students currently enrolled in the ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Nest program. If you are applying to ASD programs for the first time, please visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms for the application and contact ASDprograms@schools.nyc.gov with questions.
